titles: Popery and tyranny, or, The present state of France, in relation to its government, trade, manners of the people, and nature of the countrey as it was sent in a letter from an English gentleman abroad, to his friend in England, wherein may be seen the tyranny the subjects of France are under ...
author: English gentleman abroad.
notes: Reproduction of original in Huntington Library.
keywords: France --  Economic conditions --  Early works to 1800.
